info.author: Eli Fulkerson
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License (GPL)
info.description:
Hardscan is a local netstat replacement that scans for open ports by binding to
each of them and attempting to handshake with itself. If the handshake fails, it
is likely that some hidden process is using the port.  This utility is meant to
be useful in a situation where you may have been rootkitted, rendering the
output of netstat and other security tools untrustworthy.
info.name: hardscan
info.platform:
Tested on Debian Sarge, Windows 2000 and Windows XP.  Expected to be platform
independent.
info.summary: Utility to detect open ports if netstat may be compromised
info.html_description: Hardscan is a local netstat replacement that scans for open ports by binding to each of them and attempting to handshake with itself. If the handshake fails, it is likely that some hidden process is using the port. This utility is meant to be useful in a situation where you may have been rootkitted, rendering the output of netstat and other security tools untrustworthy.
